title: Timeline Operations
purpose: Chronological record of all case activities providing complete audit trail and case history navigation

workflowContext.dataFlow: Timeline aggregates events from all modules into a unified chronological view, serving as the single source of truth for case history

entryTypes.description: Case advanced or remanded to different stage
Hearing scheduled, conducted, or outcome recorded
Task created, assigned, completed, or escalated
examples: Task 'Prepare Reply' assigned to Advocate A

entryTypes.description: Email sent, SMS delivered, or call logged
examples: Email sent to client: Case Update

entryTypes.description: Free-form case note for internal reference
examples: Waiting for client to provide invoices

entryTypes.description: Statutory deadline created, extended, or met
examples: Reply deadline set: 30 days from notice

quickActions.bestPractice: Use for events not captured automatically (client decisions, external meetings)
Keep notes concise; link to relevant documents if applicable
Filter to 'Hearings + Orders' for quick litigation history

quickActions.outcome: Generates PDF or Excel of timeline
quickActions.bestPractice: Export filtered view for specific reports (e.g., hearing history only)

commonWorkflows.name: Pre-Hearing Case Review
steps: Review key events in chronological order

commonWorkflows.name: Export for Court Submission
steps: Select relevant entry types (Hearings, Orders, Submissions)

dateRange.tip: Use 'Last 90 days' for hearing preparation; 'All time' for comprehensive review

entryType.tip: Combine multiple filters for focused views (e.g., Hearings + Documents)

actor.tip: Filter by actor to see one person's contributions to the case

Partner.focus: High-level case history, key milestones, strategic decisions

Manager.keyMetrics: Entry count per case, gap identification

Advocate.focus: Case preparation, document trail, hearing history
Advocate.keyMetrics: Events in last 30 days, pending items

Staff.focus: Data entry verification, document upload confirmation

warnings.title: Auto-Generated Entries Cannot Be Edited
warnings.message: System-generated timeline entries (hearings, tasks, documents) are read-only for audit integrity. Only manual entries can be edited.

warnings.title: Timeline is Permanent Record
warnings.message: All entries are permanently recorded. Manual entries can be marked as 'Corrected' but not deleted.

warnings.title: Use Milestones for Key Decisions
warnings.message: Record client decisions, strategy changes, and external events as Milestones for complete case history.

warnings.title: Export Before Important Meetings
warnings.message: Export a filtered timeline PDF before client meetings or court appearances for quick reference.

troubleshooting.solution: Clear all filters, expand date range, verify source event exists
Auto-generated entries cannot be edited; add corrective note instead
Clear filters before export or expand date range
